Dear Ms. Black-Moore:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
06/25/2019. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the ISEP
and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter
and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(b) Verification of education.
One of seven new employee files reviewed does not have
verification of education.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows, unless a
greater frequency is medically indicated:
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months before
placement or a new physical examination shall be completed
within 30 calendar days after placement.
(iii) A physical examination every 14 months.
(c)(ii) One of six foster care files reviewed does not have a
physical exam completed within 12 months before placement or
a new physical examination completed within 30 calendar days
after placement.
(c)(iii) One of six foster care files reviewed does not have an
updated physical examination completed within 14 months.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
(a) One of eleven treatment plans is not completed within 30
calendar days.
Treatment plan period 04/23/2019 to 05/23/2019 is pending as
of 06/10/2019.

 DHHS Policy 722-06B Family Team Meetings
Two of eleven foster care treatment plans reviewed did not have a family team
meeting for the development of the treatment plan.
 DHHS Policy FOM 722-6H Unannounced home visit to the licensed foster
home must be completed at least once per quarter when a foster care child is
in care.
Two of eleven foster care treatment plans reviewed did not have an
unannounced quarterly home visit documented in social work contacts.
 DHHS Policy FOM 801 Medical passport is to be provided to the legal parent(s)
and foster parent(s) within two weeks of initial placement and each quarter
thereafter with current and complete health information.
Five of six foster care files reviewed did not have updated quarterly medical
passports that are signed and dated by all required parties.

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
DCWL Analyst Finding – There are no concerns for safety alert 1, 2 and 3.
There are no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Spectrum Child and Family Services submitted one acceptable corrective action
plan not related to maltreatment during this licensing period. The corrective action
plan is from their 7/2018 interim inspection. Compliance with the corrective action
plan is met except for the repeat citations stated in this report.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
6

Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
